olcr7u.introText: I bring a proven track record in managing growth and operations that align with Arcadia's mission to revolutionize clean energy access.
bulletPoints: **Leadership in Growth Strategy:** While I was Growth Ops Manager at Countable, I led growth strategy that resulted in a 150% increase in partnerships, showcasing my ability to drive impactful initiatives.
**Market Expansion Expertise:** While I was Launch Manager at Uber, I successfully built new markets from the ground up, demonstrating my capability in managing diverse and challenging portfolios.

**Data-Driven Decision Making:** At CloudKitchens, as a Product Manager, I rolled out robotics to 100+ locations, enhancing support efficiency by 80%, emphasizing my proficiency in data and project management.
**Client Relationship Management:** During my tenure as Regional Manager at Ritual, I improved restaurant satisfaction by 40%, ensuring client goals were met and markets were thriving.

**Cross-Functional Collaboration:** At Countable, my leadership in getting our app featured multiple times on the App Store highlights my ability to work collaboratively across teams to achieve significant milestones.
olcr7u.jobContent:
Job Application for Revenue Operations Manager at ArcadiaBack to jobsNewRevenue Operations ManagerUnited StatesApplyWho We Are 

Arcadia is the technology company empowering energy innovators and consumers to fight the climate crisis. Our software and APIs are revolutionizing an industry held back by outdated systems and institutions by creating unprecedented access to the data and clean energy needed to make a decarbonized energy grid possible.

In 2014, Arcadia set out on its mission to break the fossil fuel monopoly and since then we have been knocking down the institutional barriers to unlock decarbonization. To date, we have connected hundreds of thousands of consumers and small businesses with high-quality clean energy options. Fast forward to today, and now, we’re thinking even bigger. We have launched Arcadia Platform, an industry-defining SaaS platform that empowers developers and energy innovators to deliver their own custom, personalized energy experiences, accelerating the transformation of the industry from an analog energy system into a digitized information network.

Tackling one of the world’s biggest challenges requires out-of-the-box thinking & diverse perspectives. We’re building a team of individuals from different backgrounds, industries, & educational experiences. If you share our passion for ushering in the era of the clean electron, we look forward to learning what you would uniquely bring to Arcadia!

What we’re looking for:

We are seeking a highly motivated leader to join our Community Solar Revenue Operations team. This individual will be responsible for managing a portfolio of community solar projects in a number of different markets. The ideal candidate is a driven self-starter that is motivated to leverage their project management, data, and leadership skills to fight climate change!

Arcadia is open to fully remote candidates and employees have access to co-working spaces.

#LI-REMOTE

What you'll do:

Manage a portfolio of Community Solar projects, driving strategy and initiatives that optimize the financial health of these systems
Partner with the data team to build, and maintain the metrics required to track the health of your projects and ensure obligations are being met
Develop market-specific SOPs in partnership with the Director, Rev Ops, and team leads across the globe
Own the relationship with utility representatives to ensure that: 

We maintain accurate and complete subscriptions for all projects under management
There is an appropriate escalation path for the billing team to navigate billing and crediting issues 

Ad-hoc/problem-solving of key market, developer, and financing issues
Complete requests when same-day delivery is required 
Work extensively with Client facing team to ensure

Client goals are being met 
Projects are prioritized appropriately
Utility blockers and issues are communicated effectively 
Market-specific requirements are fully understood and can be communicated back to client 

Ensure we comply with all market-specific regulations and reporting requirements 
Become a community solar subject matter expert and contribute to maintaining our knowledgebase of utility-specific operating procedures and regulations
Work extensively with billing and credit reconciliation teams to understand under-performance, host bill results, host banked credit amounts, and adjust strategy as needed
Collaborate with a global team to ensure the timely delivery of contractual obligations
Work with the waitlisting/onboarding team to ensure projects are 100% subscribed 

What will help you succeed:

Must-haves:

Bachelor’s Degree
Excellent excel skills with theability to extract and convey themes to internal and external stakeholders from large data sets
Demonstrated experience aligning and influencing cross-functional teams and diverse stakeholders
Advanced project management skills
Proactive communication style
Proven ability to break down complex problems and implement iterative solutions
A growth mindset and comfort with ambiguity
Rigorous attention to detail
Have a passion for clean energy and an interest in helping to better the environment

Nice-to-haves:

Strong preference will be given to those with 3+ years working in the energy industry 
Proficiency in SQL and HEX

Benefits:

"Remote first" culture - work anywhere in the US as long as you have a reliable internet connection
Flexible PTO - no accrued hours and no limit on the number of vacation days exempt employees can take each year
17 annual company-wide holidays including a week-long "summer break"
10 days sick leave
Up to 4 weeks bereavement leave
2 volunteer days off
2 professional development days off
12 weeks paid parental leave for all parents
80-95% employer cost coverage for medical, dental, and vision benefits for employees and dependents

Eliminating carbon footprints, eliminating carbon copies.

Here at Arcadia, we cultivate diversity, celebrate individuality, and believe unique perspectives are key to our collective success in creating a clean energy future. Arcadia is committed to equal employment opportunities regardless of race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, national origin, age, disability, genetic information, protected veteran status, or any status protected by applicable federal, state, or local law. Please note that we are unable to offer visa sponsorship for this position at this time

We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us to request accommodation by emailing careers@arcadia.com.

Target Annual Compensation Range for this role will be $85,000 to $145,000. There will also be a competitive benefits and equity (bonus if applicable) component to the package. The exact compensation at which this job is filled will be determined by the skills, experience, and location of the qualified candidate.

Thank you

Apply for this job*

indicates a required field

First Name*Last Name*Preferred First NameEmail*Phone*Location (City)Locate meResume/CV*AttachAttachDropboxGoogle DriveEnter manuallyEnter manuallyAccepted file types: pdf, doc, docx, txt, rtf

Cover LetterAttachAttachDropboxGoogle DriveEnter manuallyEnter manuallyAccepted file types: pdf, doc, docx, txt, rtf

Education

School*Select...Degree*Select...DisciplineSelect...Add anotherAre you legally eligible to work in the U.S.?*Select...Will you now or in the future require visa sponsorship for employment at Arcadia?*Select...While we are currently unable to consider candidates who will require visa sponsorship, we welcome applications from all qualified candidates eligible to work in the United States.

Do you currently live in the U.S.?*Select...If Yes, what state do you currently live in?Select...What are your pronouns? (optional)Arcadia Self-Identification QuestionsFor government reporting purposes, we ask candidates to respond to the below self-identification survey. Whatever your decision, it will not be considered in the hiring process or thereafter. Any information that you do provide will be recorded and maintained in a confidential file.

As set forth in Arcadia’s Equal Employment Opportunity policy, we do not discriminate on the basis of any protected group status under any applicable law.

---

If you believe you belong to any of the categories of protected veterans listed below, please indicate by making the appropriate selection. As a government contractor subject to the Vietnam Era Veterans Readjustment Assistance Act (VEVRAA), we request this information in order to measure the effectiveness of the outreach and positive recruitment efforts we undertake pursuant to VEVRAA. Classification of protected categories is as follows:

A "disabled veteran" is one of the following: a veteran of the U.S. military, ground, naval or air service who is entitled to compensation (or who but for the receipt of military retired pay would be entitled to compensation) under laws administered by the Secretary of Veterans Affairs; or a person who was discharged or released from active duty because of a service-connected disability.

A "recently separated veteran" means any veteran during the three-year period beginning on the date of such veteran's discharge or release from active duty in the U.S. military, ground, naval, or air service.

An "active duty wartime or campaign badge veteran" means a veteran who served on active duty in the U.S. military, ground, naval or air service during a war, or in a campaign or expedition for which a campaign badge has been authorized under the laws administered by the Department of Defense.

An "Armed forces service medal veteran" means a veteran who, while serving on active duty in the U.S. military, ground, naval or air service, participated in a United States military operation for which an Armed Forces service medal was awarded pursuant to Executive Order 12985.

---

Voluntary Self-Identification of Disability
Why are you being asked to complete this form?

We are required to measure our progress toward having at least 7% of our workforce be individuals with disabilities. To do this, we must ask applicants and employees if they have a disability or have ever had a disability. Because a person may become disabled at any time, we ask all of our employees to update their information at least every five years.

Identifying yourself as an individual with a disability is voluntary, and we hope that you will choose to do so. Your answer will be maintained confidentially and not be seen by selecting officials or anyone else involved in making personnel decisions. Completing the form will not negatively impact you in any way, regardless of whether you have self-identified in the past. For more information about this form or the equal employment obligations of federal contractors under Section 503 of the Rehabilitation Act, visit the U.S. Department of Labor’s Office of Federal Contract Compliance Programs (OFCCP) website at www.dol.gov/ofccp.

How do you know if you have a disability?

You are considered to have a disability if you have a physical or mental impairment or medical condition that substantially limits a major life activity, or if you have a history or record of such an impairment or medical condition.

Disabilities include, but are not limited to:

Autism
Autoimmune disorder, for example, lupus, fibromyalgia, rheumatoid arthritis, or HIV/AIDS
Blind or low vision
Cancer
Cardiovascular or heart disease
Celiac disease
Cerebral palsy
Deaf or hard of hearing
Depression or anxiety
Diabetes
Epilepsy
Gastrointestinal disorders, for example, Crohn's Disease, or irritable bowel syndrome
Intellectual disability
Missing limbs or partially missing limbs
Nervous system condition for example, migraine headaches, Parkinson’s disease, or Multiple sclerosis (MS)
Psychiatric condition, for example, bipolar disorder, schizophrenia, PTSD, or major depression
Gender or Gender Identity*Select...Please identify your race and/or ethnicity. Please check all that apply:*Select...Veteran Service Status: *Select...Disability Status*Select...Submit applicationPowered by

GreenhouseRead our Privacy Policy

4fkmf1.introText: I'm the right person for the Product Strategist due to my experience in leading product vision and program management for multiple product lines, resulting in a 150% ARR growth within 6 months at CloudKitchens.
bulletPoints: **Product Leadership:** While I was Product Manager at CloudKitchens, I took the Otter Lockers product from concept to market, achieving a 150% growth in ARR in just 6 months.

**Team Management:** While I was Regional Manager at Ritual, I built and managed a team of 4 City Managers across North America, launching operations in 3 major US markets with over $1M+ monthly GMV each.

**Cross-functional Collaboration:** While I was Growth Operations Manager at Countable, I orchestrated cross-functional collaborations and established strategic partnerships, leading to 150%+ growth in partnerships.
**Data-Driven Decisions:** While I was Product Manager at CloudKitchens, I developed SQL queries and dashboards to help teams make data-driven decisions, reducing support escalations by 80%.

 Careers

 Explore How the World Runs
And Make It Better

 Open Roles

 We’re changing the way engineering and robotics connect to the built world

 We need creative problem solvers to help accelerate our mission. 

 We believe it’s time for a new kind of engineering role capable of building technology to address the needs of the physical world. We want engineers who are not limited by discipline, and who aspire to wield a wide variety of skills, from software, data, and algorithms to firmware, robot integration, and mechanical engineering. Does this sound like you?

We have many open positions below, but if you do not fall into one category or feel like your approach to engineering is more expansive, we still want to talk to you. Sign up to receive updates and be notified when we begin actively hiring for this new kind of engineering position in early 2025!

 Receive Updates

 Make a Real Impact

 With innovative robotics technologies and software solutions, your work will help the world’s most vital industries and institutions solve their biggest challenges to create a stronger, safer, and more resilient future.

 Our Robots are 
Powered by Humans

 Join Our Team

 Both behind the scenes and in the field, we bring together the brightest minds to drive what's possible. Join our diverse team to be at the forefront of innovation and transformation.

 Our Mission

 Ensuring the availability, reliability, and sustainability of critical infrastructure.

 At Gecko Robotics, we help the world’s most important organizations understand and protect their physical assets. 

Through advanced robotics and enterprise software solutions, we provide unprecedented insight into the health of critical infrastructure assets, enabling data-driven decision making.

We are a team of innovators, driven by solving complex problems in energy, manufacturing, defense, and other critical industries.

We ideate, create, iterate, and inform, providing the tools and solutions to drive responsible asset management at scale.

 People at Gecko really take pride in the work that they do and really resonate with the mission statement. It translates into everything and into all facets of the company.

 Antony Tahan
 Forward Deployed Engineer

m47m2l.introText: I'm the right person for the Product Strategist at Gecko Robotics because I led growth strategies that increased restaurant partner retention by 40% and grew monthly active users by 300% across 15+ markets at Ritual.
bulletPoints: **Forward-Thinking Leadership:** While I was a Product Manager at CloudKitchens, I took Otter Lockers product 0 → 1, growing ARR 150% in 6 months.
**Scalable Solutions:** While I was a Regional Manager at Ritual, I launched and scaled operations in 3 major US markets, each achieving $1M+ monthly GMV.
**Team Management:** While I was a Regional Manager at Ritual, I built and managed a team of 4 City Managers across North America.
**Strategic Growth:** While I was a Growth Operations Manager at Countable, I led D.C. business development efforts, resulting in 150%+ growth through partnerships.
**Data-Driven Insight:** While I was a Product Manager at CloudKitchens, I developed SQL queries and dashboards to help teams make data-driven decisions.

uaxe4x.introText: I'm the right person for the Senior Electrical Engineer at Gecko Robotics because I scaled autonomous robotics systems to 100+ facilities in 18 months while maintaining high NPS scores.
bulletPoints: **Scalable Systems:** While I was Product Manager at CloudKitchens, I scaled autonomous robotics systems to 100+ facilities in 18 months while keeping NPS scores above 90.
**Engineering Leadership:** In my role at CloudKitchens, I directed a remote team of 10 engineers, designers, and data scientists to ship robotics and food delivery products.
**Cross-functional Expertise:** At Ritual, I served as the voice of the customer to product and engineering teams, influencing roadmap priorities for 15+ markets.
**Robotics Integration:** During my time at CloudKitchens, I led product vision and program management for five distinct product lines, including robotics.
**Rapid Growth:** As Regional Manager at Ritual, I grew monthly active users by 300% across 15+ markets in the first year.

ebxyht.introText: I'm the right person for the Product Manager at Meta because I have extensive experience leading cross-functional teams to develop transformative products, managing the full product life-cycle, and driving strategic initiatives with a focus on user satisfaction and market impact.
bulletPoints: **Product Vision:** While I was Product Manager at CloudKitchens, I led the product vision and GTM strategy for five distinct product lines, significantly impacting the company's growth trajectory.
**Team Leadership:** As a Regional Manager at Ritual, I built and managed a team of 4 City Managers across North America, successfully scaling operations in multiple markets.

**Data-Driven Insights:** At Countable, I integrated market analysis and usability studies into product strategies, resulting in feature placements on the App Store and significant user engagement growth.

**Cross-Functional Collaboration:** During my tenure at Uber, I collaborated with local regulators and cross-functional teams to launch and scale major markets in North Carolina, establishing key partnerships with universities and businesses.
**Entrepreneurial Execution:** At CloudKitchens, I took the Otter Lockers product from 0 to 1, achieving a 150% ARR growth in just 6 months.
ebxyht.jobContent:
Meta Product Managers work with cross-functional teams of engineers, designers, data scientists and researchers to build products. We are looking for extremely entrepreneurial Product Managers to help innovate and execute product initiatives across the company and value moving quickly. This job description represents different full-time roles across Meta.
Product Manager Responsibilities
Is the primary driver for identifying significant near and long-term opportunities in a large Product area, and driving product vision, strategies and roadmaps in the context of broader organizational strategies and goals.
Generate buy-in and drives consensus across organizations. Bring clarity and structure to ambiguous opportunities. Consistently demonstrate initiative and execute with limited oversight.
Plan, initiate, and manage information technology projects for web-based products, applications, and platforms.
Integrate data, usability studies, research, and market analysis into product strategies and requirements to enhance user satisfaction and improve engineer productivity.
Drive product development with teams of world-class engineers and designers, while maintaining team health.
Understand Meta’s strategic and competitive position and deliver products that are aligned with our mission and recognized best in the industry.
Work closely with cross-functional teams to drive product vision, define product requirements, coordinate resources from other groups (design, legal, etc.), develop roadmaps, and guide the team through key milestones.
Define and analyze metrics that inform the success of products. Identify and track key performance metrics. Drive decision-making through user insights, quantitative analysis and AB testing.
Maximize efficiency in a constantly evolving environment where the process is fluid and creative solutions are the norm.
Minimum Qualifications
10+ years product management and/or Product Design
10+ years of experience working collaboratively with engineering, design and user research teams
Experience navigating through the full product life-cycle, integrating customer feedback into product requirements, driving prioritization, and pre/post-launch execution
Critical thinking/analytical leadership experience
Experience presenting to senior executive audiences
BA/BS in Computer Science or related field
Preferred Qualifications
Experience in a consumer focused technology company
Experience building 0-1 products, platform/ecosystem products, or marketplaces

4zbaci.introText: I'm the right person for the Product Manager at Meta because I have extensive experience leading cross-functional teams to execute transformative product initiatives and thrive in fast-paced environments.
bulletPoints: **Growth Leader:** While I was Product Manager at CloudKitchens, I took the Otter Lockers product from 0 to 1, achieving a 150% increase in ARR within six months.
**Scale Architect:** While I was Product Manager at CloudKitchens, I scaled autonomous robotics systems to 100+ facilities in 18 months while maintaining NPS scores above 90.
**Efficiency Enhancer:** While I was Product Manager at CloudKitchens, I reduced facility technology support escalations by 80% through implementing self-serve ops tooling.
